metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Job Overview
Hitachi Vantara is looking for a strategic Pricing Business Analyst to help plan for and deliver operational innovation, value creation, and price optimization.  
You will innovate through the design and enhancement of pricing-related systems and processes.  This role is scoped broadly to manage and deliver target price guidance, agile pricing and packaging system capabilities, automation of business rules, and operational analytics to our global and local cross-functional stakeholders.  More importantly, in this role your focus is on making it easier and more valuable for our customers, partners, and prospects to do business and to do business with us.
Specifically, this role will be responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and optimizing the operational systems and processes that support CPQ capabilities. In addition, you will identify, propose, and help to lead the execution of improvements across pricing processes and systems to create operational efficiencies, optimize revenue and margins, and deliver better pricing outcomes.
This position lives in our Pricing Strategy and Enablement team.  You will have the opportunity to work with and learn from Sales Operations, IT, Partner Operations, Sales, Pre-Sales, Customer Support, Customer Success, and Finance at all levels of the organization.  You will also collaborate with suppliers of our pricing capabilities (Conga, PROS, SFDC, etc.), as well as provide occasional support of system-related inquiries from field sales personnel.
Key Job Responsibilities
Focus on “What are we making better for others?”
•	Drive, influence and help to lead the design and implementation of processes and systems to enable Sales and our selling partner community to optimize their value capture and operational efficiency
•	Developing dynamic and agile pricing tools to effectively respond to changing market needs and trends
•	Verify and maintain pricing functionality within and across pricing-related systems
•	Support the reporting of the business impact of pricing workflows, systems, and processes, and recommend changes to Strategic Pricing Operations leadership to improve financial performance and operational benefits
•	Deliver global and localized pricing capabilities that meet or innovate the market expectation
•	Assess requirements and data from a variety of sources to gain insights, drive decision-making, and monitor success
•	Keep the organization informed on industry trending for pricing and packaging capabilities, and methods, and forward-thinking
•	Be the subject matter expert and expert user for Conga pricing features and functionality – own and operate pricing engine rules, validations, etc. 
•	Work with Sales Operations and Partner Operations to define, configure, test, and maintain the Approval Workflow process in its entirety for each monetization model
If you can provide vision, planning, design, and ownership, please apply!
Price Dimensions, Price Matrix, Price Ruleset, Field Expressions, Related Pricing, Tier Pricing, Dependent Pricing, Products, Pricing, Catalog, XAuthor, Shopping Cart, Constraint Rules, and Product Attribute Rules
Qualifications
•	Bachelor's Degree, plus 5-8 years related experience
•	Excellent Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills. Excel macro experience a plus
•	Experience using Conga CPQ (formerly Apttus), Salesforce.com, Tableau, Power BI, PROS, Vendavo, Zilliant, Model N, or other similar data reporting and pricing tools with large datasets
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
•	Development experience in Apttus/Conga CPQ
•	Salesforce Administration experience
•	Deep understanding of Conga CPQ and CLM processes & system
•	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; strategic systems & process thinker
•	Ability to apply sound business judgment, personal initiative and resourcefulness
•	Ability to successfully operate in a dynamic environment and work with changing business requirements
•	Must have experience in X-Author for Excel; X-Author Contracts experience would be nice to have also, but not required
•	Understanding of product configuration management: products, bundles, inclusion rules, recommendation rules, constraint rules
•	Bonus points given if you have completed Conga CPQ 201/202 training, and CLM Essentials

title: Conga/Apttus Pricing Administrator
content:
We’re Hitachi Vantara, a global infrastructure business. Our people are the force of meaningful progress. We enable the incredible with data – from taking theme park fans on magical rides, conserving natural resources, protecting rainforests to saving lives. We empower businesses to automate, optimize and advance innovation. Together, we create a sustainable future for all. 
Imagine the sheer breadth of talent it takes to inspire he future. We don’t expect you to ‘fit’ every requirement – your life experience, character, perspective, and passion for achieving great things in the world are equally important to us.What You Will Be Doing
Hitachi Vantara is looking for a strategic Conga/Apttus Pricing Administrator to help plan for and deliver operational innovation, value creation, and price optimization. 
You will innovate through the design and enhancement of pricing-related systems and processes.  This role is scoped broadly to manage and deliver target price guidance, agile pricing and packaging system capabilities, automation of business rules, and operational analytics to our global and local cross-functional stakeholders.  More importantly, in this role your focus is on making it easier and more valuable for our customers, partners, and prospects to do business with us.
Specifically, this role will be responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and optimizing the operational systems and processes that support CPQ capabilities. In addition, you will identify, propose, and help to lead the execution of improvements across pricing processes and systems to create operational efficiencies, optimize revenue and margins, and deliver better pricing outcomes.
This position lives in our Pricing Strategy and Enablement team.  You will have the opportunity to work with and learn from Sales Operations, IT, Partner Operations, Sales, Pre-Sales, Customer Support, Customer Success, and Finance at all levels of the organization.  You will also collaborate with suppliers of our pricing capabilities (Conga, PROS, SFDC, etc.), as well as provide occasional support of system-related inquiries from field sales personnel.
 
What you will be doing
Focus on “What are we making better for others?”

Drive, influence and help to lead the design and implementation of processes and systems to enable Sales and our selling partner community to optimize their value capture and operational efficiency
Developing dynamic and agile pricing tools to effectively respond to changing market needs and trends
Verify and maintain pricing functionality within and across pricing-related systems
Support the reporting of the business impact of pricing workflows, systems, and processes, and recommend changes to Strategic Pricing Operations leadership to improve financial performance and operational benefits
Deliver global and localized pricing capabilities that meet or innovate the market expectation
Assess requirements and data from a variety of sources to gain insights, drive decision-making, and monitor success
Keep the organization informed on industry trending for pricing and packaging capabilities, and methods, and forward-thinking
Be the subject matter expert and expert user for Conga pricing features and functionality – own and operate pricing engine rules, validations, etc.
Work with Sales Operations and Partner Operations to define, configure, test, and maintain the Approval Workflow process in its entirety for each monetization model.

What You Will Bring To The Team

Bachelor's Degree, plus 5-8 years related experience
Excellent Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills. Excel macro experience a plus
Experience using Conga CPQ (formerly Apttus), Salesforce.com, Tableau, Power BI, PROS, Vendavo, Zilliant, Model N, or other similar data reporting and pricing tools with large datasets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Development experience in Apttus/Conga CPQ
Deep understanding of Conga CPQ and CLM processes & system
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; strategic systems & process thinker
Ability to apply sound business judgment, personal initiative and resourcefulness
Ability to successfully operate in a dynamic environment and work with changing business requirements
Must have experience in X-Author for Excel; X-Author Contracts experience would be nice to have , but not required
Understanding of product configuration management: products, bundles, inclusion rules, recommendation rules, constraint rules
Bonus points given if you have completed Conga CPQ 201/202 training, and CLM Essentials

If you can provide vision, planning, design, and ownership, please apply!
Price Dimensions, Price Matrix, Price Ruleset, Field Expressions, Related Pricing, Tier Pricing, Dependent Pricing, Products, Pricing, Catalog, XAuthor, Shopping Cart, Constraint Rules, and Product Attribute Rules
As required by the equal pay and transparency acts, the expected base salary for this position is:
Tier One Location (including New York, and San Francisco): $116,000 - $155,000
Tier Two Location (including Colorado, Seattle, and the rest of California): $101,000 - $144,000
Tier Three Location (including the rest of Washington State): $81,000 – $115,000
The expected pay is determined based on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, depth of experience in the practice area. Employees are eligible to participate in Hitachi Vantara’s bonus/variable pay programs, where applicable, and are subject to the program’s conditions and restrictions.
 
#LI-JT1Championing diversity, equity, and inclusion 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.
How we look after you
We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).
About us
We’re a global team of innovators. Together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for insight to co-create meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into data-driven leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society. If you believe that innovation can inspire the future, this is the place to fulfil your purpose and achieve your potential.
We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

demographic_questions.description:
At Hitachi Vantara, we value the diversity of our workforce and strive to foster an inclusive environment in which talent from all backgrounds can thrive, bringing their unique contributions to our culture and success. We are an equal opportunity employer and seek to strengthen our hiring practices by identifying and mitigating the potential for bias in our assessment and selection processes.

Below is a set of voluntary demographic questions that, if you choose to complete, will provide aggregated data to inform our hiring strategy and help us uphold our commitment to inclusive hiring.  Your responses, or choice to not respond, will in no way be linked to your specific application and will not be used to inform the hiring decision.

Our company does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or veteran status. In order to track the effectiveness of our recruiting efforts and ensure we consider the needs of all our employees, please consider the following optional questions

questions.label: Do you consider yourself a member of the LGBTQIA+ community?
Current Address (Street Address, City, State, Country, Zip Code)
Are you legally authorized to work in the country where this job is located?
Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment?

Are you a citizen from one of the countries listed here?
(Needed to determine if export authorization is required).
If yes, do you have dual citizenship (i.e., a citizen of another country) or legal permanent residency in another country?
If yes, please list such country(ies) below. If no, respond "no"

questions.description:
Please click HERE to read the Hitachi Vantara Data Protection Privacy Statement. 

By checking the box labeled “I Consent” on this submission page and submitting my personal data to the Company, I confirm that I have read, understand, and consent to the terms and conditions, including those which are provided via hyperlinks on this page, in which my personal data will be processed by the Company.
questions.label: Data Protection Notification and Consent Form*

Do you currently, or have you ever worked for any company within the Hitachi Group? 
E.g., Hitachi Rail, Hitachi Energy etc.
If yes, please specify the Hitachi company name. If no, respond "no"
